title: BitTorrent API Cross Site Scripting Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of BitTorrent and uTorrent. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
These applications expose a web service locally on port 10000. An attacker can use a cross site scripting vulnerability in this web service to obtain a credential allowing full access to the web service. An attacker can leverage this to execute code under the context of the current user.
addtionnal_details: BitTorrent has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://download-01.utorrent.com/uuid/bafd4502-33a8-4ce4-9720-2183638e4281
timeline:
2016-02-01 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2016-05-20 - Coordinated public release of advisory
